title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Using stars_proxy Objects
text: can either set proxy object calling cms_native_proxy() cms_zarr_prox(). first uses ‘native’ service. case data already structured chunked files added value proxy objects obvious. Therefore, vignette, focus objects created cms_zarr_proxy(). connect entire layer product.
code: library(CopernicusMarine) library(stars, quietly = TRUE) #> Linking to GEOS 3.12.1, GDAL 3.8.4, PROJ 9.4.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE  my_proxy_gc <- cms_zarr_proxy(   product       = "GLOBAL_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_001_024",   layer         = "cmems_mod_glo_phy-thetao_anfc_0.083deg_P1D-m",   asset         = "geoChunked")  my_proxy_tc <- cms_zarr_proxy(   product       = "GLOBAL_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_001_024",   layer         = "cmems_mod_glo_phy-thetao_anfc_0.083deg_P1D-m",   asset         = "timeChunked")  print(my_proxy_tc) #> stars_proxy object with 1 attribute in 1 file(s): #> $thetao #> [1] "[...]/timeChunked.zarr" #>  #> dimension(s): #>           from   to     offset  delta  refsys #> longitude    1 4320         NA     NA      NA #> latitude     1 2041         NA     NA      NA #> elevation    1   50         NA     NA udunits #> time         1 1364 2022-06-01 1 days    Date #>                                                            values x/y #> longitude            [-180.0417,-179.9583),...,[179.875,179.9584) [x] #> latitude            [-80.04167,-79.95833),...,[89.95834,90.04166) [y] #> elevation [-5727.917,-5274.784) [m],...,[-0.494025,0.5533251) [m]     #> time                                                         NULL

title: Using stars_proxy Objects
text: can see proxy object printed , dimension stretch pretty far. daily data nearly four years, 50 depth layers global coverage. try read raster data, almost certainly fail require thousands Gb memory simply available devices. Fortunately, proxy object can easily sliced, selecting index values bracket operator ([). first index represents band (attribute), skip , next x y coordinate, followed elevation. last dimension time, select first four hundred records. can notice, slicing super fast. actual data transfered yet. isn’t st_as_stars() called data downloaded. Since particular case selected single raster cell, makes sense cast object data.frame. can plot time series.  can also select specific area, use time chunked proxy.
code: time_slice <- my_proxy_gc[,2000, 1000, 48, 1:400] show(time_slice) #> stars_proxy object with 1 attribute in 1 file(s): #> $thetao #> [1] "[...]/geoChunked.zarr" #>  #> dimension(s): #>           from   to     offset  delta  refsys              values x/y #> longitude 2000 2000         NA     NA      NA     [-13.46,-13.37) [x] #> latitude  1000 1000         NA     NA      NA       [3.208,3.292) [y] #> elevation   48   48         NA     NA udunits [-2.646,-1.541) [m]     #> time         1  400 2022-06-01 1 days    Date                NULL time_slice <- st_as_stars(time_slice) |> as.data.frame() plot(time_slice$time, time_slice$thetao,      xlab = "date", ylab = "temperature", type = "l") geo_slice <- my_proxy_tc[,2000:2500, 1500:1750, 50, 500] plot(geo_slice, col = hcl.colors(10))

title: Translate Request
text: use R functions cms_product_details() cms_product_metadata() look Copernicus Marine Service data. prefer using graphical user interface, can use website find suitable dataset: https://data.marine.copernicus.eu/products. located suitable dataset website, ‘form’ link can used enter subset data. screen capture video demonstrates form can used specify request. also shows can copy request, form command line (Python) code, clipboard. clipboard, can translate request code R named list cms_translate().

title: Translate Request
text: example demonstrates strategy can used download subset data. shows can translate command line code, obtained website, can translated named list. Note example , code explicitly entered code passed argument cms_translate()-call. cases necessary. leave text argument cms_translate() empty, look request system clipboard. Now translated code, can actually download data? can pass named list arguments cms_download_subset() using .call(). Like :
code: library(CopernicusMarine) ## Example of command line code ## copied from website: cli_code <- "copernicusmarine subset   --dataset-id cmems_mod_glo_phy_anfc_0.083deg_PT1H-m   --variable uo   --variable vo   --start-datetime 2025-01-01T00:00:00   --end-datetime 2025-01-01T23:00:00   --minimum-longitude -2   --maximum-longitude 8   --minimum-latitude 52   --maximum-latitude 59   --minimum-depth 0.49402499198913574   --maximum-depth 0.49402499198913574"  translated <- cms_translate(cli_code) summary(translated) #>               Length Class   Mode      #> product       1      -none-  character #> layer         1      -none-  character #> variable      2      -none-  character #> region        4      -none-  numeric   #> timerange     2      POSIXct numeric   #> verticalrange 2      -none-  numeric result <- do.call(cms_download_subset, translated) plot(result, col = hcl.colors(100), axes = TRUE)

title: Search Download and Handle Data from Copernicus Marine Service Information
text: package provides interface R Copernicus Marine services. Note services need account comply specific terms. usage section briefly shows three different ways obtaining data Copernicus: Downloading subset Downloading full dataset Using WMTS server Please check manual complete documentation package. example demonstrates subset specific layer specific product. subset constrained region, timerange verticalrange arguments. subset downloaded memory represented stars object.  can also use request code Copernicus Marine Service website download subset. details see vignette("translate") addition also possible subset data stars_proxy objects, using either cms_zarr_proxy() cms_native_proxy(). explained detail vignette("proxy"). don’t want subset data want complete set, can download complete native files, available product. can list available files (restricted first 10 results max=10): Downloading specific (multiple file) can done : file, whose file name matches pattern, stored specified destination folder. default progress printed files can large may take time download. Web Map Tile Services (WMTS) allow quickly plot pre-rendered images onto map. may useful need data analyses handy quick visualisations, inspection presentation data. title: How to cite a Copernicus marine product — cms_cite_product
code:
cms_cite_product("SST_MED_PHY_SUBSKIN_L4_NRT_010_036") #> $doi #> [1] "E.U. Copernicus Marine Service Information; Mediterranean Sea - High Resolution Diurnal Subskin Sea Surface Temperature Analysis - SST_MED_PHY_SUBSKIN_L4_NRT_010_036 (2021-04-23). DOI:10.48670/moi-00170" #>  #> $id #> [1] "SST_MED_PHY_SUBSKIN_L4_NRT_010_036" #>  #> $type #> [1] "Collection" #>  #> $stac_version #> [1] "1.0.0" #>  #> $stac_extensions #> $stac_extensions[[1]] #> [1] "https://stac-extensions.github.io/scientific/v1.0.0/schema.json" #>  #>  #> $title #> [1] "Mediterranean Sea - High Resolution Diurnal Subskin Sea Surface Temperature Analysis" #>  #> $description #> [1] "For the Mediterranean Sea - the CNR diurnal sub-skin Sea Surface Temperature (SST) product provides daily gap-free (L4) maps of hourly mean sub-skin SST at 1/16° (0.0625°) horizontal resolution over the CMEMS Mediterranean Sea (MED) domain, by combining infrared satellite and model data (Marullo et al., 2014). The implementation of this product takes advantage of the consolidated operational SST processing chains that provide daily mean SST fields over the same basin (Buongiorno Nardelli et al., 2013). The sub-skin temperature is the temperature at the base of the thermal skin layer and it is equivalent to the foundation SST at night, but during daytime it can be significantly different under favorable (clear sky and low wind) diurnal warming conditions. The sub-skin SST L4 product is created by combining geostationary satellite observations aquired from SEVIRI and model data (used as first-guess) aquired from the CMEMS MED Monitoring Forecasting Center (MFC). This approach takes advantage of geostationary satellite observations as the input signal source to produce hourly gap-free SST fields using model analyses as first-guess. The resulting SST anomaly field (satellite-model) is free, or nearly free, of any diurnal cycle, thus allowing to interpolate SST anomalies using satellite data acquired at different times of the day (Marullo et al., 2014).
 
[How to cite](https://help.marine.copernicus.eu/en/articles/4444611-how-to-cite-or-reference-copernicus-marine-products-and-services)

https://doi.org/10.48670/moi-00170

* Buongiorno Nardelli B., C.Tronconi, A. Pisano, R.Santoleri, 2013: High and Ultra-High resolution processing of satellite Sea Surface Temperature data over Southern European Seas in the framework of MyOcean project, Rem. Sens. Env., 129, 1-16, doi:10.1016/j.rse.2012.10.012.

what: Download raw files as provided to Copernicus Marine — cms_download_native
title: Download raw files as provided to Copernicus Marine — cms_download_native
text: Full marine data sets can downloaded using functions documented . Use cms_list_native_files() list available files, cms_download_native() download specific files. Files usually organised per product, layer, year, month day.

title: Download raw files as provided to Copernicus Marine — cms_download_native
code: cms_download_native(   destination,   product,   layer,   pattern,   prefix,   progress = TRUE,   ... )  cms_list_native_files(product, layer, pattern, prefix, max = Inf, ...)

title: Download raw files as provided to Copernicus Marine — cms_download_native
text: destination Path store downloaded file(s). product identifier (type character) desired Copernicus marine product. Can obtained cms_products_list. layer name desired layer within product (type character). Can obtained cms_product_services (listed id column). pattern regular expression (regex) pattern. paths match pattern returned. can used select specific files. instance pattern = "2022/06/", files year 2022 month June listed (assuming file path structured , see examples) prefix character string. prefix added search path files. matching file (info) downloaded (generally faster using pattern) progress logical value. TRUE progress bar shown. ... Ignored max maximum number records returned.

title: Download raw files as provided to Copernicus Marine — cms_download_native
text: Returns NULL invisibly.

title: Download raw files as provided to Copernicus Marine — cms_download_native
text: Pepijn de Vries

title: Download raw files as provided to Copernicus Marine — cms_download_native
code: if (interactive()) {   cms_list_native_files(     product       = "GLOBAL_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_001_024",     layer         = "cmems_mod_glo_phy_anfc_0.083deg_PT1H-m",     prefix        = "2022/06/"   )  ## If you omit the prefix, you may want to limit the ## number of results by setting `max`   cms_list_native_files(     product       = "GLOBAL_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_001_024",     layer         = "cmems_mod_glo_phy_anfc_0.083deg_PT1H-m",     max           = 10   )    ## Prefix can be omitted when not relevant:   cms_list_native_files(product = "SEALEVEL_GLO_PHY_MDT_008_063")    ## Use 'pattern' to download a file for a specific day:   cms_download_native(     destination   = tempdir(),     product       = "GLOBAL_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_001_024",     layer         = "cmems_mod_glo_phy_anfc_0.083deg_PT1H-m",     prefix        = "2022/06/",     pattern       = "m_20220630"   ) }

title: Subset and download a specific marine product from Copernicus — cms_download_subset
text: username Copernicus marine user name. Can provided cms_get_username() (default), argument . password Copernicus marine password. Can provided cms_get_password() (default), argument . product identifier (type character) desired Copernicus marine product. Can obtained cms_products_list. layer name desired layer within product (type character). Can obtained cms_product_services (listed id column). variable name desired variable specific layer product (type character). Can obtained cms_product_details. region Specification bounding box vector numerics WGS84 lat lon coordinates. order : xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax. timerange vector two elements (lower upper value) requested time range. vector coercible POSIXct. verticalrange vector two elements (minimum maximum) numerical values depth vertical layers (). Note values sea surface needs specified negative values. progress logical value. TRUE (default) progress reported console. Otherwise, function silently proceed. crop . version now uses GDAL library handle subsetting downloading subsets. crop argument therefore longer supported. asset Type asset used subsetting data. one "default", "ARCO", "static", "omi", "downsampled4". missing, set NULL set "default", use first asset available requested product layer, order listed . ... Ignored (reserved future features).

title: Translate Python code or command line request to R list — cms_translate
code: python_code <- "import copernicusmarine  copernicusmarine.subset(   dataset_id=\"cmems_mod_glo_phy_anfc_0.083deg_PT1H-m\",   variables=[\"uo\",\"vo\"],   minimum_longitude=-2,   maximum_longitude=8,   minimum_latitude=52,   maximum_latitude=59,   start_datetime=\"2025-01-01T00:00:00\",   end_datetime=\"2025-01-01T23:00:00\",   minimum_depth=0.49402499198913574,   maximum_depth=0.49402499198913574, )"  cli_code <- "copernicusmarine subset   --dataset-id cmems_mod_glo_phy_anfc_0.083deg_PT1H-m   --variable uo   --variable vo   --start-datetime 2025-01-01T00:00:00   --end-datetime 2025-01-01T23:00:00   --minimum-longitude -2   --maximum-longitude 8   --minimum-latitude 52   --maximum-latitude 59   --minimum-depth 0.49402499198913574   --maximum-depth 0.49402499198913574"  if (interactive()) {   cms_translate(python_code)   cms_translate(cli_code)   translated <- cms_translate(cli_code)   do.call(cms_download_subset, translated) }

title: Obtain a WMTS entry for specific Copernicus marine products and add to a leaflet map — cms_wmts_details
text: Pepijn de Vries

title: Obtain a WMTS entry for specific Copernicus marine products and add to a leaflet map — cms_wmts_details
code: if (interactive()) {   wmts_details <-     cms_wmts_details(       product  = "GLOBAL_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_001_024",       layer    = "cmems_mod_glo_phy-thetao_anfc_0.083deg_P1D-m",       variable = "thetao"     )    capabilities <-     cms_wmts_get_capabilities("GLOBAL_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_001_024")    if (nrow(wmts_details) > 0) {     leaflet::leaflet() |>       leaflet::setView(lng = 3, lat = 54, zoom = 4) |>       leaflet::addProviderTiles("Esri.WorldImagery") |>       addCmsWMTSTiles(         product  = "GLOBAL_ANALYSISFORECAST_PHY_001_024",         layer    = "cmems_mod_glo_phy-thetao_anfc_0.083deg_P1D-m",         variable = "thetao")   } }
